intro: Lippia fissicalyx, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties. Lippia fissicalyx is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
